title: CULTURAL & HERITAGE TOUR OF NEPAL
description: Highlights:‚ÄúA cultural tour around Kathmandu valley visiting ancient religious sitesFascinating world heritage monuments of immense interest and livel...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrive in Kathmandu meet our staff and transfer to hotel.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            On arrival in Kathmandu international airport via respective airlines where Guru travels staff receives you with warm welcome and then transfer to your hotel around Thamel area in the hub of Kathmandu.
Thamel an interesting place with many shops and stores and international standard restaurants including shops-stores, Guru Travel guide will brief you with details and information of the hotels and Cultural & Heritage Tour of Nepal with welcome dinner in a nice Nepali restaurant includes folk culture program.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Tour of Kathmandu around places of interest.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            These two days you will engrossed with interesting and delightful tour around Kathmandu and Patan cities. 
Morning starts with tour around Kathmandu, steeped with ancient heritage sites and monuments of both Hindu and Buddhist, morning after breakfast our tours starts with a short drive to Swayambhunath, a popular and famous pilgrimage sites for Buddhist and Hindu as well. 
An ancient Chaitiya of Asia and a major symbol of Nepal‚Äôs Buddhist heritage, Swayambhunath represents Primordial Buddha or Adi-Buddha. 
The hill top where Swayambhunath Chaitiya is built is called Padmagiri, Vajrakuta, Gosringa, Gopuchha, Samhegu, and Simbhu and listed as UNESCO World Heritage Site. 
Swayambhunath area offers grand views of whole Kathmandu valley with distant snow capped peaks.
After Swayambhunath visit Patan or Lalitpur City, which is close to Kathmandu and an adjoining city located south of Kathmandu on the other side of Bagmati River, an historical and cultural area with old palace buildings, artistic courtyard. 
After Patan tour leads to Bouddhanath, an important Buddhist pilgrimage and heritage sites in Nepal.  The story and history mentions that this Stupa contains relics of Buddha Kashyapa, with 176 miniature stupas and paintings of Tibetan Buddhist pantheons cover the walls that surround the Stupa at Bouddhanath. 
Bouddhanath Stupa is an important pilgrimage site for Tibetans which is mentioned in Tibetan classical texts such as Biography of Yeshe Tshogyal (A.D. 8-9) and Padma Ka‚Äôthang (A.D.14).

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Dhulikhel and visit Namodbuddha holy sites.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Located beyond the eastern rim of Kathmandu valley on the Tibet / China & Nepal Friendship Highway an hour drive where one can stay for overnight or more.
Dhulikhel at 1,440 meters, this beautiful spot offers panorama of High Mountain from Manaslu, Ganesh Himal in the far west to Langtang, Jugal Himal towards central north and as far to eastern horizon Gaurishankar, Melungatse Himal to Everest on clear fine day, Dhulikhel famous for Newari culture and popular as for resorts on route to Tibet and Jiri. 
Here with time in the afternoon visit to holy Namobuddha, which is near south of Dhulikhel just 20 minutes drive within pristine environment, a holy place for Buddhist, the old history belief is that Buddha on the path of learning-offered his own body without regret to a tigress suffering.
One of the unsurpassable supreme sacred sites known as the Three Stupas in Nepal is Tagmo L√ºjin (lit "The place where the future Buddha sacrificed his body to a tigress"). It is the very sacred place where our teachers, the perfect and supreme Buddhafrom great hunger. What follows is a history of this supreme and distinguished sacred site, whose location is unmistaken based on the clear identification given in the Sutra Requested by the Tigress and so forth.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Chitwan National park for jungle safari.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast an overland drive to low land of Nepal called Terai around warm semi-tropical areas, where deep dense jungles are located.
After a scenic driving past many villages and towns reaching at outskirt of Chitwan National Park where all nice hotels-lodge and resorts are placed, at Chitwan using the best hotels or resort for 2 overnight stops, after lunch a short introductory tour or nature walks with dinner accompanied by local Tharu culture dance programs.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: In Chitwan full jungle activities and elephant safari.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Full day jungle and nature programs starting early morning before breakfast with varieties of
activities includes elephant safari (morning or late afternoon) jungle / nature walks-bird watch tour, canoe ride to see crocodile and water birds, jungle drive with enjoyable elephant bathing and briefing, afternoon Jungle drive / Jungle or Nature walks or elephant safari (if not done earlier).

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Lumbini birth place of Lord Buddha
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Lumbini ‚ÄúThe Birth Place of Sakyamuni Buddha: (5 hrs drive from Chitwan)
Morning after an exciting time in Chitwan, then an interesting overland drive on the southern and west of Nepal to reach at Lumbini.
Located in South West Nepal, close to Indian border, Lumbini has a small airport, Lumbini meaning in Sanskrit for "the lovely" most important Buddhist pilgrimage site. 
Lumbini is the traditional birthplace of Gautama Buddha, the founder of Buddhism, who was born in the 7th or 6th century BC. On reaching at Rupendhi in Lumbini transfer to hotel close to Buddha‚Äôs birth place areas.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Morning visit Lumbini holy sites and drive to Kathmandu.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Morning visit Maya Devi temple mother of Sakyamuni Buddha as the dates back 642 BC. 
In 249 BC, the Buddhist converted Emperor Ashoka of India, visited Lumbini and constructed four stupas and a stone pillar. Asoka‚Äôs Pillar bears an inscription that translates as: "King Piyadasi (Ashoka), beloved of devas, in the 20 year of the coronation, himself made a royal visit, Buddha Sakyamuni having been born here, a stone railing was built and a stone pillar erected to the Bhagavan ["blessed one"] having been born here. Lumbini village was taxed reduced and entitled to the eight parts (only)".
The site was rediscovered in 1895, when a German archaeologist came upon Asoka‚Äôs Pillar, identified by its inscription. Records made by the Chinese pilgrim Fa Xian were also used in the process of identifying this religiously acclaimed site. Lumbini was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1997.
After an interesting tour drive back to Kathmandu on the interesting highway taking more than 6-7 of exciting overland drive, on reaching Kathmandu transfer back to respective hotels.
(optional by air from Bhairawa airport to Kathmandu 45 mins of scenic flight)

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: In Kathmandu free day for individual activities.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            In Kathmandu free day to enjoy at leisure for own personal individual activities shopping souvenirs or can book for another interesting sightseeing tour around Kathmandu-Patan or Bhaktapur. We also arrange early mountain flight of one hour with views of Mt. Everest along with other chain of snowcapped peaks.

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: International departure
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Last day in unique Nepal after a memorable experience on ‚ÄúCultural & Heritage Tour of Nepal‚Äù with great services of Guru Travels, and as per your international flight time, our staff transfers you to airport for the flight back home or to respective countries.

booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure

title: 8 Days Culture, Wildlife and Heritage of Nepal
description: A Journey Through Nepal‚Äôs Living Heritage, Timeless Temples, and Breathtaking LandscapesOverview of JourneyIf you are dreaming of a once-in-a-lifetime...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Day 1: Welcome to Kathmandu (1,400m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Arrive at Tribhuvan International Airport where our representative welcomes guests with a traditional Tika and flower garland. After a comfortable transfer and hotel check-in, guests have some time to relax. In the evening, enjoy a welcome dinner at a heritage-style restaurant, featuring authentic Nepali cuisine and a classical live cultural dance performance, introducing Nepal‚Äôs rich artistic traditions.Dinner at Hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 02
itinerary.description:
: UNESCO Heritage Sites of Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, explore Kathmandu‚Äôs key UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Visit Swayambhunath Stupa (Monkey Temple), a 2,000-year-old Buddhist shrine with stunning valley views. Proceed to Pashupatinath Temple, the sacred Hindu temple on the banks of the Bagmati River. Then, walk around the serene Boudhanath Stupa, a major center for Tibetan Buddhism. In the afternoon, explore Kathmandu Durbar Square, once the royal palace, where guests can see intricately carved temples, courtyards, and the Kumari Ghar (home of the Living Goddess).  Dinner at Hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 03
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu to Chitwan ‚Äì Tharu Culture Experience
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Depart from Kathmandu to Pokhara by flight after breakfast in the morning. Upon arrival, guests are welcomed with drinks and settle into a comfortable resort. In the late afternoon, explore a nearby Tharu village and visit the Tharu Cultural Museum to learn about their indigenous lifestyle and history. In the evening, canoeing at Rapti river then a tharu stick dance performance, showcasing unique traditions of this ethnic group. Dinner is served at the resort.

itinerary.title: Day 04
itinerary.description:
: Chitwan to Pokhara ‚Äì Journey to the Lake City
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, enjoy jeep safari at Chitwan National park. Take a flight from Bharatpur airport. Welcome to a picturesque city famous for its natural beauty and Himalayan views. Upon arrival, check in at a lakeside hotel. In the evening, enjoy a serene boat ride on Phewa Lake and visit the Tal Barahi Temple on the lake‚Äôs island, a place of local spiritual importance. Rest of the evening is free to enjoy the lakeside ambience. Dinner at Hotel

itinerary.title: Day 05
itinerary.description:
: Pokhara Sightseeing ‚Äì Culture, Spirituality and transfer to Ghandruk
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Optional early morning drive to Sarangkot to witness sunrise over the Annapurna and Machhapuchhre (Fishtail) mountains. Return for breakfast and begin a full-day Pokhara tour: visit the International Mountain Museum, explore Bindhyabasini Temple, and the sacred Gupteshwor Cave with nearby Devi's Fall. Drive toward Ghandruk. Reach in the evening and enjoy traditional Gurung Culture with cultural food. Enjoy music and traditional instruments. Dinner at local homestay.

itinerary.title: Day 06
itinerary.description:
: Return to Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After Breakfast,  return back to Pokhara then fly Kathmandu in the m (25-min flight). After check-in, the afternoon is free for personal activities‚Äîshopping in Thamel, local caf√©s, or optional spa sessions. Dinner at a Hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 07
itinerary.description:
: Patan and Bhaktapur ‚Äì Living Art & Architecture
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today, travel to the ancient city of Patan (Lalitpur) to explore Patan Durbar Square, known for its magnificent stone and metalwork. Visit the Golden Temple, Krishna Mandir, and traditional artist workshops to witness artisans working on thangkas, metal statues, and wood carvings. Drive to Bhaktapur, a perfectly preserved medieval city, famous for its 55-Window Palace, Nyatapola Temple, and Pottery Square, where guests can try hands-on pottery-making with local artisans. Return to Kathmandu in the evening.

itinerary.title: Day 08
itinerary.description:
: Departure from Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, transfer to the international airport for final departure. Guests receive a small handcrafted souvenir as a keepsake of their unforgettable Nepal experience.

booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure

title: Annapurna circuit trek with Tilicho lake and North base camp
description: Annapurna circuit trek with tilicho lake and north base camp is one of the high altitude trek in Nepal where you will circulate world's 10'th highest ...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Drive Kathmandu to beshisahar
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Our official member will meet you at thamel and lead you to tourist bus station and take a tourist bus drive from kathmandu to beshisahar. After reaching beshisahar guide will give you overall brefing and buy missing items. Beshisahar is a market place in lamjung district and also a gate way to annapurna circuit trek where you can find a essential items for trek as well.

Drive distance-  Approx 180km

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Besisahar (760m) to Chame (2,670m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            On this day after breakfast at hotel we will take jeep and drive to chame. A thrilling jeep ride takes you from Besisahar to Chame, the headquarters of Manang district. The rough road climbs steeply along cliffs, waterfalls, and narrow gorges. As you ascend, you'll notice the change in vegetation from subtropical forests to pine and fir trees. Chame (2,670m) offers stunning views of Lamjung Himal and Annapurna II.
 
Altitude: 1310m
 Distance:65km
 Note: Road is rough and mostly landslide in monsoon.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Chame to Upper Pisang (3,300m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Your trek officially begins today, covering 14‚Äì15 km through pine forests and rocky ridges. The trail offers panoramic views of Annapurna II and Pisang Peak. You‚Äôll pass the majestic Paungda Danda rock face before reaching the ancient village of Upper Pisang, known for its traditional Tibetan architecture.

Altitude Gain: 630m
Distance: 14km
Landscape: Forests, rivers, apple orchards, cliffs

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Upper Pisang to Manang (3,540m) via Ghyaru & Ngawal
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            On this day after breakfast we will start a trek through the high route via Ghyaru and Ngawal, we will gain roughly 800m in elevation before descending to Manang. You will be able to view panoramic views of Annapurna III, Gangapurna, and Tilicho Peak. The trail is steep and exposed in places but culturally rich.

Altitude Gain: 240m
Distance: 15KM
Landscape: Arid alpine terrain, old Buddhist monasteries
Note: Dry air and altitude can cause headaches‚Äîhydrate well.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Acclimatization Day in Manang (Optional hike to Ice Lake or Gangapurna  Lake)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            This day will be your acclimatization day. You can take an optional hike to Ice Lake (~4,600m) or Gangapurna Lake, which helps your body adjust in high altitude. Manang is also one of the most beautiful village around the trek. Visit the Himalayan Rescue Association for AMS information.

Note: Highly recommended to hike higher and sleep lower.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Manang to Shree Kharka (4,060m
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            We will be following mountain rule where after crossing 3000m we will not acend more then 500m per day. The trail diverts from the main Annapurna Circuit today, heading toward Tilicho Lake. It climbs gradually through alpine grasslands. Shree Kharka is located at serene surroundings and basic accommodation.

Altitude Gain: 520m
Distance: 8-9 km
Note: Stay alert around landslide areas and walk in a group.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Siri Kharka to Tilicho Base Camp (4,150m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            A short but tricky trail leads to Tilicho Base Camp. The path is unstable cliffs and narrow ridges and mostly windy weather where you should be careful. Views will get more beautiful as you approach tilicho base camp.

Altitude Gain:90m
Distance: 6-7 km
Note: Wear a dust mask and avoid loose rock areas.

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Hike to Tilicho Lake (4,919m) and return to shree Kharka
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today our guide will lead you to tilicho lake early morning to avoid high winds. It will take around Tilicho Lake, one of the world‚Äôs highest lakes. The lake offers unmatched views of Tilicho and Nilgiri. After spending time at the lake, descend to Shree Kharka.

Altitude Gain: +769m  descend -859m
Total distance: 22km

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Siri Kharka to Yak Kharka (4,050m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            You rejoin the Annapurna Circuit trail today. The route climbs gradually, passing through alpine pastures and juniper bushes. You‚Äôll reach Yak Kharka, a seasonal grazing area with limited teahouses.

Altitude Gain/Loss: Minimal
Duration: 5‚Äì6 hrs
Note: Beware of altitude symptoms and drink warm fluids.

itinerary.title: Day 10
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Yak Kharka to Thorong Phedi (4,450m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            A slow ascent takes you to the foot of Thorong La Pass. The trail includes rocky terrain and a landslide section. Thorong Phedi is a cold, windy place, and you‚Äôll need to rest early for the big day ahead.

Altitude Gain: +400m
Duration: 4‚Äì5 hrs
Note: Early sleep is important. Tomorrow‚Äôs pass is tough.

itinerary.title: Day 11
itinerary.description:
: Cross Thorong La Pass (5,416m) and descend to Muktinath (3,760m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The most challenging and rewarding day. Start before 4 AM to cross Thorong La, the highest point of the trek. After reaching the prayer-flag-covered summit, descend steeply to the holy site of Muktinath, a Hindu-Buddhist pilgrimage town.

Altitude Gain: +966m ‚Üí descend -1,656m
Duration: 8‚Äì9 hrs
Note: Carry energy snacks and wear layers. Risk of snow and wind.

itinerary.title: Day 12
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Muktinath to Ghasa (2,010m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, take a jeep downhill to Ghasa via Jomsom and Marpha. The ride passes through the dry Mustang region and then lush pine forests of the lower Kali Gandaki valley. Ghasa is a small village known for its biodiversity.

Altitude: 3,760m ‚Üí 2,010m
Duration: 6‚Äì7 hrs
Note: Roads are bumpy. Dust mask recommended.

itinerary.title: Day 13
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Ghasa to Narchyang Village (1,500m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Trek through terraced fields, waterfalls, and charming Magar villages. The trail is moderately steep at times but culturally rewarding. Narchyang offers warm hospitality and is a gateway to the lesser-known Annapurna North.

Altitude Loss: -510m
Duration: 5‚Äì6 hrs
Note: Prepare for warmer weather again‚Äîshed layers.

itinerary.title: Day 14
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Narchyang to Hum Khola (Lower Annapurna North BC  approach
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The path today gradually climbs through rhododendron forests and bamboo groves to Hum Khola. This remote camp is the staging area for the Annapurna North Base Camp hike.

Altitude Gain: +1,300m
Duration: 6‚Äì7 hrs
Note: Trail is less developed‚Äîcarry essentials and stay with guide.

itinerary.title: Day 15
itinerary.description:
: Trek to Annapurna North Base Camp (4,190m) and return to Hum Khola
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            A long and strenuous day to the breathtaking Annapurna North Base Camp‚Äîa sacred and rarely visited spot. Towering views of Annapurna I‚Äôs north face greet you. After photos and packed lunch, return to Hum Khola.

Altitude Gain: +1,390m ‚Üí descend
Duration: 7‚Äì8 hrs
Note: Steep ascent; carry water, wear sun protection.

itinerary.title: Day 16
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Hum Khola to Narchyang Village
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Retrace your steps down to Narchyang, with ample time to relax and interact with locals. Enjoy cultural exchange and prepare for the return to urban comfort.

Altitude Loss: -1,300m
Duration: 5‚Äì6 hrs
Note: Knees may feel the descent‚Äîuse trekking poles.

itinerary.title: Day 17
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Narchyang to Pokhara (827m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The adventure concludes with a beautiful drive to Pokhara via Beni and Baglung. You‚Äôll return to the warmth of the city, reflecting on your epic 17-day high-altitude journey across one of the most diverse trekking circuits in the Himalayas.

Altitude: 1,500m ‚Üí 827m
Duration: 6‚Äì7 hrs
Note: Celebrate with a lakeside dinner in Pokhara!

booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure

title: Api Base Camp Trek-12Nights/13Days
description: OverviewApi Base Camp Trek is a hidden gem in the remote far-western region of Nepal, offering anunparalleled trekking experience through pristine lan...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Kathmandu (1,400m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Upon arrival in Kathmandu, you will be greeted by our team and transferred to your hotel. The
vibrant capital city of Nepal is rich in history, culture, and architectural wonders. You can explore
UNESCO World Heritage Sites such as Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple), Boudhanath Stupa,
and the sacred Hindu temple of Pashupatinath. Strolling through the bustling streets of Thamel,
you can experience Nepal‚Äôs lively atmosphere, shop for trekking gear, and enjoy authentic
Nepali cuisine. In the evening, a short briefing about the trek will be provided, ensuring you are
well-prepared for the adventure ahead.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Flight to Dhangadhi & Drive to Gokuleshwar (850m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            A scenic flight from Kathmandu to Dhangadhi offers breathtaking views of the lush Terai plains
and distant Himalayan ranges. Upon landing, we embark on a long yet rewarding drive to
Gokuleshwar, passing through charming villages, forests, and winding mountain roads. The
drive provides a glimpse into rural Nepalese life, where terraced fields and local bazaars
showcase the region‚Äôs traditional lifestyle. Gokuleshwar, a small town nestled in the hills, serves
as our first overnight stop before heading deeper into the remote regions of the trek.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Latinath and Trek to Makarigaad (1,800m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, a short drive takes us to Latinath, a town known for its ancient Hindu shrines.
From here, we start our trek towards Makarigaad, following a scenic trail through terraced
farmlands and small settlements. The path gradually ascends, offering magnificent views of the
surrounding hills and the Mahakali River valley. As we walk through traditional villages, we have
the opportunity to interact with the friendly locals, learning about their unique customs and way
of life. The day ends in Makarigaad, where we set up camp or stay in a local teahouse,
surrounded by the serene beauty of the Himalayas.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Makarigaad to Siti (2,200m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The trail from Makarigaad to Siti takes us through lush pine and rhododendron forests, where
the chirping of birds and rustling of leaves provide a peaceful trekking experience. As we gain
elevation, the views become even more spectacular, revealing snow-capped peaks in the
distance. The region is home to diverse wildlife, and if lucky, we might spot Himalayan blue
sheep or musk deer. Siti is a small settlement with traditional stone houses, where the warm
hospitality of the locals makes us feel at home. The day‚Äôs trek provides an excellent balance of
natural beauty and cultural immersion.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Siti to Domal (2,900m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Leaving Siti, we follow a rugged trail that leads us into higher altitudes. The landscape
transitions from dense forests to vast alpine meadows, where yaks graze peacefully. Domal is a
sacred site for both Hindus and Buddhists, attracting pilgrims from nearby villages. This spiritual
significance adds a mystical touch to the trek, as prayer flags flutter in the crisp mountain air.
The presence of ancient shrines and stone cairns along the path gives insight into the
deep-rooted beliefs of the local communities. We spent the night in Domal, preparing for the
challenging journey ahead.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Domal to Api Base Camp (4,000m) & Explore
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today marks the most exhilarating part of our journey as we ascend towards Api Base Camp.
The trail is demanding yet incredibly rewarding, as we cross glacial streams and traverse rocky
moraines. The panoramic views of Api Himal (7,132m) and its surrounding peaks are
breathtaking, making every step worthwhile. Upon reaching the base camp, we take in the
pristine beauty of the Himalayas, with towering cliffs and massive glaciers surrounding us. This
remote and untouched region offers a true sense of wilderness, where we can fully immerse
ourselves in the grandeur of nature.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Rest & Exploration Day at Api Base Camp
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            A well-deserved rest day at Api Base Camp allows us to explore the surroundings at a relaxed
pace. We can take short hikes to nearby viewpoints, where the sunrise casts a golden glow over
the snow-covered peaks. The base camp area is a photographer‚Äôs paradise, offering
unmatched scenery. For those interested in high-altitude trekking, optional hikes to glacial ridges
provide thrilling experiences. The peaceful environment, free from commercial tourism, makes
this day truly special, allowing us to appreciate the raw beauty of Nepal‚Äôs far-western
Himalayas.

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Api Base Camp to Domal (2,900m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After an unforgettable experience at Api Base Camp, we begin our descent towards Domal.
Retracing our steps, we pass through vast meadows and icy streams, soaking in the incredible
views one last time. The return journey offers a different perspective, as the changing light
highlights new facets of the landscape. With the physical demands of ascending behind us, we
can fully enjoy the serenity of the trek, capturing final glimpses of the mighty Himalayas before
reaching Domal for an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Domal to Siti (2,200m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The trek from Domal to Siti is a pleasant descent through forests and rolling hills. Along the way,
we encounter cascading waterfalls and gushing rivers, their sounds adding to the peaceful
ambiance. As we lose altitude, the air becomes warmer, and we start seeing more vegetation.
We may come across herders with their livestock, a reminder of the traditional way of life in
these mountains. Reaching Siti, we take the time to interact with the locals, sharing stories of
our journey and enjoying traditional mountain hospitality.

itinerary.title: Day 10
itinerary.description:
: Trek from Siti to Makarigaad (1,800m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Continuing our descent, we make our way back to Makarigaad. The familiar landscape now
feels different, as we view it from a fresh perspective. The trek offers plenty of opportunities to
reflect on the journey, appreciating the beauty and solitude of Nepal‚Äôs far-western region.
Arriving in Makarigaad, we celebrate the completion of our trek with a warm meal and a
comfortable night‚Äôs rest.

itinerary.title: Day 11
itinerary.description:
: Trek to Latinath and Drive to Gokuleshwar (850m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Our final trekking day takes us back to Latinath, where we board a vehicle for the drive to
Gokuleshwar. The journey allows us to reflect on the adventure, cherishing the memories of
remote landscapes, towering peaks, and warm encounters with local communities. Back in
Gokuleshwar, we enjoy a well-earned rest before heading back to city life.

itinerary.title: Day 12
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Dhangadhi & Flight to Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            A scenic drive to Dhangadhi is followed by a flight back to Kathmandu, where the comforts of
the city await. The flight provides one last chance to admire Nepal‚Äôs diverse landscapes, from
the towering Himalayas to the lush Terai. Arriving in Kathmandu, we can spend the evening
reminiscing about our adventure, exploring the city‚Äôs vibrant streets, or enjoying a farewell
dinner with fellow trekkers.

itinerary.title: Day 13
itinerary.description:
: Departure from Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            With unforgettable memories and a heart full of experiences, we bid farewell to Nepal. Our team
will transfer you to the airport, ensuring a smooth departure. As you leave, the call of the
mountains remains, inspiring future adventures in Nepal‚Äôs majestic landscapes.

booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure

title: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra - 10Days/11Nights
description: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra ‚Äì 9N/10D via Kathmandu (For Nepali Citizens)Organized by Guru Travels Limited Tour Overview:Join a spiritually transformative...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Kathmandu to Kyirong
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Your journey begins with a scenic drive from Kathmandu to Kyirong. As you travel, you‚Äôll be treated to breathtaking views of lush valleys, traditional villages, and the majestic Himalayas. After crossing the Nepal-Tibet border at Rasuwagadhi, you‚Äôll arrive in Kyirong, a peaceful Tibetan town surrounded by stunning landscapes. Overnight stay in Kyirong.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Kyirong to Saga
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today, you‚Äôll drive to Saga, a vibrant town located along the banks of the Brahmaputra River. The journey takes you through the rugged beauty of the Tibetan Plateau, showcasing vast plains and striking mountain views. Saga serves as an important stop for pilgrims and travelers. Overnight stay in Saga.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Saga to Mansarovar
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            This day brings you to Lake Mansarovar, one of the holiest and most scenic lakes in the world. As you drive, Mount Kailash begins to appear on the horizon, offering a glimpse of its sacred splendor. Upon arrival, take in the pristine beauty of Mansarovar, revered for its spiritual significance and serene ambiance. Spend the night by the lakeside.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Explore Mansarovar and Drive to Darchen
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Begin the day with a tranquil exploration of Lake Mansarovar. Take in the spiritual energy and stunning vistas as you enjoy some quiet time by the lake. Afterward, embark on a short drive to Darchen, the base camp for Mount Kailash. Spend the rest of the day acclimatizing and preparing for the next phase of your journey.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Darchen to Saga
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Retrace your steps as you journey back to Saga. The drive offers another opportunity to enjoy the rugged terrain of Tibet. Upon arrival, unwind and reflect on the incredible experiences of the past few days.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Saga to Shigatse
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Travel to Shigatse, the second-largest city in Tibet. The journey takes you through picturesque landscapes, culminating in a visit to Shigatse, home to the renowned Tashilhunpo Monastery. Immerse yourself in the city‚Äôs cultural and historical charm. Overnight stay in Shigatse.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Shigatse to Lhasa
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The adventure continues as you drive to Lhasa, the spiritual heart of Tibet. Along the way, take in the breathtaking scenery of the Tibetan countryside. Upon reaching Lhasa, prepare to explore the city‚Äôs rich heritage and vibrant atmosphere.

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Explore Lhasa
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Spend the day exploring the highlights of Lhasa, including the iconic Potala Palace, Jokhang Temple, and Barkhor Street. Immerse yourself in the city‚Äôs deep spiritual roots and cultural vibrancy as you visit these renowned landmarks.

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Lhasa to Shigatse
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The return journey begins as you drive back to Shigatse. Relive the beauty of Tibet‚Äôs vast landscapes and enjoy another night in this historically significant city.

itinerary.title: Day 10
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Shigatse to Kyirong
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            From Shigatse, travel back to Kyirong, passing through the sprawling Tibetan Plateau. Bid farewell to Tibet‚Äôs majestic scenery and enjoy one final evening in Kyirong.

itinerary.title: Day 11
itinerary.description:
: Drive from Kyirong to Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The final leg of the journey takes you from Kyirong back to Kathmandu. Descend through the Himalayan foothills, enjoying the lush greenery and panoramic views along the way. Upon arrival in Kathmandu, your remarkable adventure concludes, leaving you with memories to treasure forever.

booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure

title: Mani Rimdu Festival in Everest Region-11N/12D
description: OverviewNepal is rich in cultural heritage, foods and festivals along with its UNESCO Heritage Site such as Everest Region. The Mani Rimdu Festival is...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Upon arrival at Tribhuvan International Airport, you will be greeted by Guru Travel's
representative and transferred to your hotel. After a short rest, you will attend a briefing about
the trek and the Rimdu Festival. Depending on your arrival time, you can explore UNESCO
heritage sites such as Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple), Pashupatinath, or Kathmandu
Durbar Square to experience Nepal‚Äôs rich cultural heritage. Enjoy a traditional Nepali dinner
and prepare for the adventure ahead.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Fly to Lukla (2,840m) & Trek to Phakding (2,610m) [3-4 hrs]
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            An early morning scenic flight to Lukla, the gateway to Everest, offers breathtaking views of the
Himalayas. After landing, we began our trek towards Phakding, a beautiful village situated
alongside the Dudh Koshi River. The trek passes through small Sherpa settlements and lush
green landscapes, with teahouses offering delicious foods in Everest region such as Sherpa
stew, Tibetan bread, and momos.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Trek to Namche Bazaar (3,440m) [5-6 hrs]
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today, we continue trekking along the Dudh Koshi River, crossing several suspension bridges
and entering Sagarmatha National Park, a UNESCO-listed site. The trail gradually ascends to
Namche Bazaar, the commercial hub of the Khumbu region. Here, trekkers can explore lively
markets, bakeries, and traditional Sherpa museums. The first glimpse of Mount Everest can be
seen from Namche.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Acclimatization in Namche Bazaar
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today, we continue trekking along the Dudh Koshi River, crossing several suspension bridges
and entering Sagarmatha National Park, a UNESCO-listed site. The trail gradually ascends to
Namche Bazaar, the commercial hub of the Khumbu region. Here, trekkers can explore lively
markets, bakeries, and traditional Sherpa museums. The first glimpse of Mount Everest can be
seen from Namche.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Trek to Tengboche (3,860m) [5-6 hrs]
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The trail ascends through rhododendron forests, passing small villages with stunning
mountain backdrops. We reach Tengboche Monastery, the largest monastery in the Everest
region, where the Rimdu Festival takes place. Upon arrival, we witness monks preparing for
the grand ceremonies.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Experience the Mani Rimdu Festival at Tengboche
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today is the main day of the Mani Rimdu Festival in the Everest region. Monks perform
elaborate masked dances, chanting prayers and blessings to purify negative energies. Pilgrims,
trekkers, and local villagers gather at Tengboche Monastery to celebrate. The vibrant rituals
offer a profound spiritual experience.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Additional Mani Rimdu Festival Experience
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Another day at Tengboche Monastery allows us to witness more festival ceremonies and
blessings. We engage in cultural exchanges with monks and Sherpa families, gaining deeper
insights into Himalayan Buddhism and traditions.

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Trek to Khumjung (3,790m) [4-5 hrs]
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            We begin our trek from Tengboche to Khumjung, a large Sherpa village. Along the way, we
enjoy beautiful mountain views. In Khumjung, we visit the Khumjung Monastery, home to the
famous Yeti scalp, and the Hillary School, founded by Sir Edmund Hillary. After exploring the
village, we stayed the night in Khumjung.

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: Trek to Monjo (2,835m) [5-6 hrs]
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            We descend through lush forests, passing Namche Bazaar, and head towards Monjo, a quiet
village near the entrance to Sagarmatha National Park. The trek offers breathtaking views of
the surrounding peaks, and Monjo‚Äôs peaceful setting provides a perfect place to rest for the
night.

itinerary.title: Day 10
itinerary.description:
: Trek to Lukla [5-6 hrs]
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Our final day of trekking brings us back to Lukla. We retrace our steps through forests and
along rivers, reflecting on our journey. Upon arrival in Lukla, we celebrate the successful
completion of our trek with the team, enjoying a delicious meal and sharing stories of our
adventure.

itinerary.title: Day 11
itinerary.description:
: Fly back to Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After an early breakfast, we took a scenic flight back to Kathmandu. The rest of the day is free
for shopping or sightseeing, such as visiting Swayambhunath (Monkey Temple) or strolling
through the vibrant Thamel district.

itinerary.title: Day 12
itinerary.description:
: Departure from Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            On your final day, we transfer you to the airport for your flight home, marking the end of your
incredible journey with Guru Travels Limited.

booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure

title: Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour-6N/7D
description: Trip OverviewOne of the most sacred on a spiritually enriching 7-day Buddhist pilgrimage across Nepal andIndia, tracing the footsteps of Lord Buddha t...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Bhairahawa & Lumbini Exploration
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Upon arrival at Bhairahawa International Airport, the group will be welcomed and transferred to
Lumbini, the birthplace of Lord Buddha. A full day of exploration includes the Sacred Garden,
Maya Devi Temple, Ashoka Pillar, World Peace Pagoda, and the International Monastic Zone,
featuring temples from various Buddhist traditions worldwide. After a serene day in Lumbini, the
group will check into a 4-star hotel for an overnight stay.
Accommodation: Nanc Hotel or Similar (4-Star)

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Kapilvastu Exploration & Transfer to Bhairahawa
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, the group will travel to Kapilvastu, the ancient kingdom of Prince Siddhartha.
The visit includes Tilaurakot, Kudan, Gotihawa, and Niglihawa, all significant locations linked to
Buddha‚Äôs early life.
Accommodation: Nanc Hotel or Similar (4-Star)

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Transfer to Sunauli Border & Travel to Bodhgaya
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The journey to India begins with an early morning border crossing at Sunauli. From Gorakhpur,
the group will board a train to Gaya, followed by a road transfer to Bodhgaya, a journey of about
8-9 hours. Upon arrival, they will check into their 3-star hotel and rest overnight.
Accommodation: 3-Star Hotel in Bodhgaya

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Bodhgaya Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            A full day of spiritual exploration in Bodhgaya, the place where Buddha attained enlightenment.
The group will visit the Mahabodhi Temple, Bodhi Tree, Great Buddha Statue, Thai Monastery,
Niranjana River, and Sujata Village, where Buddha received his final meal before enlightenment.
Accommodation: 3-Star Hotel in Bodhgaya

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Travel to Kushinagar
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, the group will travel 6-7 hours to Kushinagar, the site of Buddha‚Äôs
Mahaparinirvana (final enlightenment). They will visit the Mahaparinirvana Temple, Rambhar
Stupa, and Meditation Park, before checking into the hotel for an overnight stay.
Accommodation: 3-Star Hotel in Kushinagar

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Transfer to Varanasi & Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, the group will drive 5-6 hours to Varanasi, one of the oldest and holiest cities in
India. They will visit Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon, and explore Dhamek
Stupa, Mulagandha Kuti Vihara, and the Sarnath Museum. In the evening, they will witness the
spiritually uplifting Ganga Aarti ceremony at the ghats of the River Ganges before returning to
their hotel for the night.
Accommodation: 3-Star Hotel in Varanasi

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Departure to Gorakhpur & Return to Bhairahawa
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The group will depart early in the morning from Varanasi and travel 5 hours to Gorakhpur
Railway Station. From there, they will return to Sunauli, cross the border, and be picked up by a
Nepali vehicle for the final transfer to Bhairahawa Airport, marking the end of their memorable
pilgrimage

title: Tirupati Balaji South India Tour
description: Outline Itinerary Day 1: Arrival in Chennai ‚Äì Transfer to Tirupati Day 2: Tirupati ‚Äì Tirumala Darshan Day 3: Tirupati to Pondicherry Day 4: Pondicherr...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Chennai ‚Äì Transfer to Tirupati
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Your journey begins with your arrival at Chennai airport or railway station, where you will be
greeted and assisted for your onward drive to Tirupati, the sacred town famous for the Lord
Venkateshwara Temple. After reaching Tirupati, check into your hotel and relax after the journey.
Take this day to unwind or explore the surroundings at your leisure. Enjoy dinner and an
overnight stay at Tirupati .

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Tirupati ‚Äì Tirumala Darshan
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Start your day with a hearty breakfast at the hotel before heading to the Tirumala Hills, where
you will visit the renowned Lord Venkateshwara Temple. Experience the divine atmosphere and
seek blessings at this iconic pilgrimage site, often referred to as the ‚ÄúTemple of Seven Hills.‚Äù
Spend the day immersed in spiritual activities and return to your hotel in the evening for dinner
and an overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Tirupati to Pondicherry
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, check out and proceed to Pondicherry, a charming coastal town known for its
French colonial architecture and serene ambiance. Upon arrival, begin your exploration with
visits to the Manakula Vinayagar Temple, Auroville Matrimandir, and the Sri Aurobindo Ashram,
each offering a unique spiritual and cultural experience. Later, enjoy the tranquil backwaters at
Chunnambar and relax at Paradise Beach and Promenade Beach, soaking in the beauty of the
coastline. Return to your hotel for an overnight stay in Pondicherry.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Pondicherry to Madurai
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Post breakfast, check out and drive to Madurai, a historic city and one of India‚Äôs oldest
continuously inhabited places. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and freshen up. Begin your
sightseeing with a visit to the Thirumalai Nayak Palace, known for its stunning Dravidian and
Rajput architectural fusion. Later, visit the magnificent Meenakshi Amman Temple, a
masterpiece of South Indian temple architecture. End your day with dinner and an overnight
stay in Madurai.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Madurai to Rameshwaram
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, check out and proceed to Rameshwaram, a significant pilgrimage destination
and part of the Char Dham Yatra. En route, stop to admire the engineering marvels of the
Pamban Bridge and Pamban Rail Scissors Bridge, which connect the island of Rameshwaram
to the mainland. On arrival, check into your hotel and relax. Spend the evening exploring the
town or preparing for the next day‚Äôs temple visits. Overnight stay in Rameshwaram.

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Rameshwaram & Dhanushkodi Excursion
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Begin your day early with a holy dip at Agni Theertham, followed by rituals and darshan at the
Ramanatha Swami Temple, renowned for its 22 sacred wells. After breakfast, visit nearby
attractions including Parvathavarthini Amman Temple, Ramar Patham, Lakshmana Theertham,
Seetha Theertham, and the Panchmukhi Hanuman Temple. Later, take an excursion to
Dhanushkodi, a ghost town with stunning beaches and historical ruins. Return to Rameshwaram
for dinner and an overnight stay

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Rameshwaram to Kanyakumari
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Post breakfast, check out and drive to Kanyakumari, the southernmost tip of India. En route,
visit the Suchindram Thanumalayan Temple, a revered site known for its intricate carvings and
spiritual significance. On reaching Kanyakumari, check into your hotel and witness a
mesmerizing sunset at the Kanyakumari Beach. Overnight stay at Kanyakumari.

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: Kanyakumari Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Start your day early to witness a breathtaking sunrise at Triveni Sangamam, where the Arabian
Sea, Bay of Bengal, and the Indian Ocean meet. After breakfast, visit the Vivekananda Rock
Memorial, a serene monument built on a rocky islet, and the towering Thiruvalluvar Statue,
dedicated to the Tamil poet-saint. Spend the rest of the day exploring the town and soaking in its
cultural vibe. Overnight stay at Kanyakumari.

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: Kanyakumari to Trivandrum
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, check out and proceed to Trivandrum (Thiruvananthapuram), the capital of
Kerala. On arrival, visit the famous Shri Padmanabhaswamy Temple, an architectural marvel
and one of the richest temples in the world. Later, explore the city‚Äôs attractions including the
Trivandrum Zoo and Museum, known for its diverse collection of flora and fauna. Overnight stay
in Trivandrum.

itinerary.title: Day 10
itinerary.description:
: Trivandrum Departure
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            On your final day, enjoy a leisurely breakfast and check out from the hotel. You will be
transferred to the Trivandrum airport or railway station for your onward journey, carrying with you
the memories of an enriching South India tour.

booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure

title: Lumbini Pilgrimage Tour Package2N/3D
description: Lumbini Pilgrimage Tour from Kathmandu (2N/3D): Journey to the Birthplace of BuddhaIntroductionStep into peace and spirituality with the Lumbini Pilgr...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu ‚ûù Lumbini | Arrival & Evening Walk
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Morning flight/drive from Kathmandu to Bhairahawa. Transfer to hotel in Lumbini, welcome drink & check-in. After a short rest, evening walk around the Sacred Garden for a peaceful start. Dinner & overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Full-Day Lumbini Exploration | Sacred Sites & Monasteries
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, begin a guided tour of Maya Devi Temple, Ashoka Pillar, Sacred Pond, and Monastic Zone where monasteries built by Thailand, Myanmar, Japan, Germany, and others showcase unique Buddhist architecture. After lunch, visit the World Peace Pagoda and Lumbini Museum. Optional evening meditation session can be arranged. Dinner & overnight at hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Tilaurakot Excursion ‚ûù Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Morning visit to Tilaurakot, the ancient palace ruins where Prince Siddhartha spent his early life before enlightenment. Return for breakfast, check-out, and transfer to Bhairahawa for flight/drive back to Kathmandu with blessings of peace.

title: Everest From Plane
description: Everest From Plane tours are a unique way to witness the world‚Äôs highest peaks without the physical demands of trekking. Flying over the majestic Hima...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Everest by Plane
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Early in the morning, you will be picked up from your hotel and transferred to Tribhuvan International Airport (Domestic Terminal). After check-in, board a one-hour mountain flight that takes you close to the majestic Himalayas. During the journey, you‚Äôll witness stunning panoramic views of Mount Everest (8,848 m) along with other famous peaks such as Lhotse, Makalu, Cho Oyu, and Gaurishankar. Each passenger gets a window seat, and the crew will point out the mountains as you fly past.

title: Full day Kathmandu Sightseeing- 1 Day
description: Kathmandu Tour is a journey through Nepal‚Äôs vibrant capital city, where history, culture, and modern life intersect. From centuries-old temples and pa...

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu Valley Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Your tour begins with a warm welcome from your guide at your hotel, who will escort you to the Bouddhanath Stupa, one of the holiest sites for both Buddhists and Hindus. As you explore the vast stupa, you'll be surrounded by the hum of prayer wheels and the sight of pilgrims making their offerings. The iconic Buddha eyes watching over the square create a serene atmosphere. Next, you'll visit Pashupatinath Temple, an important Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Located along the Bagmati River, it‚Äôs a powerful spiritual site where you can observe daily rituals and the sacred cremation ghats. Finally, your tour will take you to Bhaktapur Durbar Square, a UNESCO World Heritage Site filled with magnificent pagoda-style temples, the ornate 55-Window Palace, and vibrant market streets. Here, you‚Äôll get a glimpse into the rich history and culture of Nepal, with beautiful architecture and bustling local life.
